definition: to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: You mean you want to have them sent with charges to be collected from the addressee?
sentences.chinese: 你是说你想拍发这些电报并让收报人付费？

sentences.english: Morse code was an early code in telegraphy.
sentences.chinese: 他嗒嗒地拍发了一份摩尔斯电码的电报。

sentences.english: The Hadley Dentre produces some of the world's most-used climate models.
sentences.chinese: 哈德利中间研拍发了世界最经常使用的气候模子。

sentences.english: We are glad to confirm our cable order dispatched this morning as follows.
sentences.chinese: 兹乐意确认今早拍发的电报订单如下。
一般价还是隔夜拍发价，先生？

sentences.english: He dispatched a telegram to announce his time of arrival.
sentences.chinese: 他拍发一封电报通知到达的时间。

definition: to reply to a telegram/to wire back
a diplomatic note/letter of understanding or concern exchanged between governments
flag signals (for communicating between ships or army units)/semaphore
